member.summary: Start the client and connect to the server.

member.name: M:WatsonWebsocket.WatsonWsClient.StartWithTimeout(System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Start the client and attempt to connect to the server until the timeout is reached.
member.param: Cancellation token to terminate connection attempts.
member.returns: Boolean indicating if the connection was successful.

member.summary: Start the client and attempt to connect to the server until the timeout is reached.

member.returns: Task returning Boolean indicating if the connection was successful.

member.name: M:WatsonWebsocket.WatsonWsServer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the Watson websocket server with a single listener prefix. Be sure to call 'Start()' to start the server. By default, Watson Websocket will listen on http://localhost:9000/.
member.param: The hostname or IP address upon which to listen.
The TCP port on which to listen.

member.name: M:WatsonWebsocket.WatsonWsServer.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the Watson websocket server with one or more listener prefixes. Be sure to call 'Start()' to start the server.
member.param: The hostnames or IP addresses upon which to listen.
The TCP port on which to listen.

member.name: M:WatsonWebsocket.WatsonWsServer.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes the Watson websocket server. Be sure to call 'Start()' to start the server.
member.param: The URI on which you wish to listen, i.e. http://localhost:9090.

member.name: M:WatsonWebsocket.WatsonWsServer.Dispose
member.summary: Tear down the server and dispose of background workers.

member.summary: Start accepting new connections.

Cancellation token allowing for termination of this request.

member.summary: Send binary data to the specified client, asynchronously.
member.param: Globally-unique identifier of the recipient client.
Cancellation token allowing for termination of this request.
member.returns: Task with Boolean indicating if the message was sent successfully.
